extension.dc:title: Bird Monitoring Data Exchange
extension.name: BirdMonitoring
extension.dc:description: Birds Canada, Bird Monitoring Data Exchange extension for Darwin Core

property.name: projectCode
property.dc:description: The code (or acronym) identifying the project within the institution during which the observation was made.

property.name: protocolCode
property.dc:description: The code (or acronym) identifying the protocol used to collect the observation data, using standards defined within your discipline. This code is more specific to your exact protocol than the ProtocolType.
property.examples: Breeding Bird Survey, Christmas Bird Count, eBird Traveling Count

property.name: protocolSpeciesTargeted
property.dc:description: A short description of the species or taxonomic group(s) targeted by the survey protocol.

property.name: protocolReference
property.dc:description: A published reference describing the protocol used to collect the observation data.

property.name: protocolURL
property.dc:description: The URL of the reference describing the protocol used to collect the observation data.

property.name: surveyAreaIdentifier
property.dc:description: A unique identifier (alphanumeric) identifying the geographic site (point count, area search plot, nest box number, colony number, etc.) at which the observation was made. The identifier must uniquely identify a site within each project and may often be contained within a Route and/or a Locality.
property.examples: Point Count point number, Area Search Plot number/letter (e.g., AB1, 12-A1B, 12345)

property.name: surveyAreaSize
property.dc:description: Size (ha) of the survey area.

property.name: surveyAreaPercentageCovered
property.dc:description: Percentage of the SurveyAreaSize actually covered during the sampling event. A missing value is assumed to represent 100%. The value can be smaller for example in cases where the presence of a shoreline reduces the effective size of the normal sampling plot.

property.name: surveyAreaShape
property.dc:description: Shape of the survey area covered by the observation event.

property.name: surveyAreaLongAxisLength
property.dc:description: Length (m) of the long axis of the survey area. In the case of a rectangle, this is equal to the size of the longest side. In the case of a circle, this is equal to the diameter.

property.name: surveyAreaShortAxisLength
property.dc:description: Length (m) of the short axis of the survey area. The short axis must be perpendicular to the long axis. In the case of a rectangle, this is equal to the size of the shortest side. In the case of a square or a circle, the short axis is equal to the long axis. In the case of a half circle, this is equal to the radius.

property.name: surveyAreaLongAxisOrientation
property.dc:description: Orientation (decimal degrees, relative to true north) of the long axis of the survey area.

property.name: coordinatesScope
property.dc:description: Geographic scope of the coordinates, indicating whether they represent the location of the individual sampling event, the route, or another broader geographic area.
property.examples: Route (starting point), SurveyArea (centroid), County (centroid), SamplingEvent (point), SamplingEvent (centroid)

property.name: samplingEventStructure
property.dc:description: Describes the structure of the SamplingEventIdentifier in a way that expresses the relationship between the sampling hierarchical levels (eg, for a stratified survey design, such as plots within quadrats within area or stops within routes). Ideally, the SamplingEventIdentifier should be composed in such a way to allows to identify these various sampling levels, and separating those by a dash. (eg, Route-Stop-UniqueID, or Site-Year-Month-Day).
property.examples: StateProvince-Route-Stop-UniqueID, Site-UniqueID, UniqueID, Site-Year-Month-Day, Site-Year-Month-Day-SurveyID, Site-Year-Month-Day-Hour-Minutes, Site-Year-Month-Day-ObserverID

property.name: routeIdentifier
property.dc:description: A unique identifier for a route, transect, set of nets, or any higher organizational unit that is comprised of 1 or more SurveyAreas, traps, or nets.
property.examples: Breeding Bird Survey route number, Point Count transect name, collection of mist nets

property.name: timeObservationsStarted
property.dc:description: The time of day the entire observation event started (this may be different from the time when the observation represented by this single record was made), expressed as decimal hours from midnight, local time (e.g., 12. = noon, 13.5 = 1:3pm).

property.name: timeObservationsEnded
property.dc:description: The time of day the entire observation event ended (this may be different from the time when the observation represented by this single record was made), expressed as decimal hours from midnight, local time (e.g., 12. = noon, 13.5 = 1:3pm).

property.name: durationInHours
property.dc:description: The total duration of the entire observation event during which this particular observation was made, expressed as decimal hours.

property.name: timeIntervalStarted
property.dc:description: Time (decimal hours) of the start of the interval where this observation was made, relative to the start of the entire observation event.
property.examples: If the observation was done during the first 5-minute interval, TimeIntervalStarted should be .

property.name: timeIntervalEnded
property.dc:description: Time (decimal hours) of the end of the interval when this observation was made, relative to the start of the entire observation event.
property.examples: If the observation was done during the first 5-minute interval, TimeIntervalEnded should be 5.

property.name: timeIntervalsAdditive
property.dc:description: Indicates whether values in ObservationCount can be added together accross different time intervals (Yes or No). "Yes" = only new individuals are reported in each interval. "No" means = all individuals are reported within each interval.

property.name: numberOfObservers
property.dc:description: The total number of observers who participated in the observation event.

property.name: effortMeasurement1
property.dc:description: A measure of the effort that was devoted to the observation event (up to 18 measures can be specified). Units are defined by the matching EffortUnits field.

property.name: effortUnits1
property.dc:description: Units of measurement for the matching effort field.
property.examples: Distance units, time units, Party-hours, Party-miles, Trap-hours, etc.

property.name: effortMeasurement2
property.dc:description: A measure of the effort that was devoted to the observation event (up to 18 measures can be specified). Units are defined by the matching EffortUnits field.

property.name: effortUnits2
property.dc:description: Units of measurement for the matching effort field.
property.examples: Distance units, time units, Party-hours, Party-miles, Trap-hours, etc.

property.dc:description: A measure of the effort that was devoted to the observation event (up to 18 measures can be specified). Units are defined by the matching EffortUnits field.

property.examples: Distance units, time units, Party-hours, Party-miles, Trap-hours, etc.

property.name: noObservations
property.dc:description: This field is used to indicate cases when no individuals (among all species targeted by the survey protocol) were detected during a sampling event (possible values: NoObs or blank). The taxon name fields for NoObs records should be left blank.

property.name: distanceFromObserver
property.dc:description: Distance (m) between observer and organism being observed. If the distance is evaluated within a range, use DistanceFromObserverMin and DistanceFromObserverMax instead.

property.name: distanceFromObserverMin
property.dc:description: Minimum distance of a range (m) between the observer and the organism being observed.

property.name: distanceFromObserverMax
property.dc:description: Maximum distance of a range (m) between the observer and the organism being observed. Use the word "Unlimited" in cases where the range has an unlimited distance.

property.name: distanceFromStart
property.dc:description: Distance (m) between the point of the observation and the start of the observation event (only applicable to non-stationary censuses).

property.name: bearingInDegrees
property.dc:description: Bearing (angle in decimal degrees from to 36) to the specimen, relative to an arbitrary bearing (e.g., north, direction of the transect or direction faced by the observer), ideally defined in the BMDR or the protocol.

property.name: specimenDecimalLatitude
property.dc:description: The latitude from which the individual record was collected, in cases where the main coordinates described above represent a centroid for the entire sampling event.

property.name: specimenDecimalLongitude
property.dc:description: The longitude from which the individual record was collected, in cases where the main coordinates described above represent a centroid for the entire sampling event.

property.name: specimenGeodeticDatum
property.dc:description: The geodetic datum to which the SpecimenDecimalLatitude and SpecimenDecimalLongitude refer. If not known, use "not recorded". This concept should be vocabulary-controlled.

property.name: specimenUTMZone
property.dc:description: The UTM zone from which the individual record was collected, in cases where the main coordinates described above represent a centroid for the entire sampling event.

property.name: specimenUTMNorthing
property.dc:description: The UTM northing from which the individual record was collected, in cases where the main coordinates described above represent a centroid for the entire sampling event.

property.name: specimenUTMEasting
property.dc:description: The UTM easting from which the individual record was collected, in cases where the main coordinates described above represent a centroid for the entire sampling event.

property.name: observationCount
property.dc:description: Number of individuals detected or observed during this observation event. In the case of presence/absence data, use 1 to indicate presence and indicate "Presence/Absence" under ObservationDescriptor

property.name: observationDescriptor
property.dc:description: Descriptor that provides information on the type of count, the behavior or location of the individuals reported, using a standard vocabulary and/or format. Use "Total Count" if the ObservationCount field contains the total count of all records for a given species, or "Presence/Absence" if the data reflects presence absence. Distance or time intervals should be entered using this format: -1 m, >1 m, -2 min., 2-5 min., etc. Other values could include age or sex classes (Adults, Juveniles, 1st Year, After 2nd Year, Males, Females, etc.), site classes (Flyover, Outside Sampling Area, Offshore, Shoreline, Inland, etc.), behavior (Singing, Calling, Sleeping, Feeding, etc.).
property.examples: TotalCount, Presence/Absence, -5 min., -1m, >1m, Offshore, Shoreline, etc.

property.name: observationCount2
property.dc:description: Number of individuals detected or observed during this observation event - up to 14 Counts and Descriptors can be attributed to this record.

property.name: observationDescriptor2
property.dc:description: Descriptor that provides information on the behavior or location of the individuals reported, using a standard vocabulary and/or format. "TotalCount" should ideally be restricted to ObservationCount only. Distance or time intervals should be entered using this format: -1 m, >1 m, -2 min., 2-5 min., etc. Other values could include age or sex classes (Adults, Juveniles, 1st Year, After 2nd Year, Males, Females, etc.), site classes (Flyover, Outside Sampling Area, Offshore, Shoreline, Inland, etc.), behavior (Singing, Calling, Sleeping, Feeding, etc.).

property.name: observationCount3
property.dc:description: Number of individuals detected or observed during this observation event - up to 14 Counts and Descriptors can be attributed to this record.

property.name: observationDescriptor3
property.dc:description: Descriptor that provides information on the behavior or location of the individuals reported, using a standard vocabulary and/or format. "TotalCount" should ideally be restricted to ObservationCount only. Distance or time intervals should be entered using this format: -1 m, >1 m, -2 min., 2-5 min., etc. Other values could include age or sex classes (Adults, Juveniles, 1st Year, After 2nd Year, Males, Females, etc.), site classes (Flyover, Outside Sampling Area, Offshore, Shoreline, Inland, etc.), behavior (Singing, Calling, Sleeping, Feeding, etc.).

property.name: obsCountAtLeast
property.dc:description: Low value of a range count of individuals detected or observed during this observation event.

property.name: obsCountAtMost
property.dc:description: High value of a range count of individuals detected or observed during this observation event.

property.name: dateUncertaintyInDays
property.dc:description: Uncertainty of the ObservationDate (decimal days), for cases where exact observation date is unknown.

property.name: allIndividualsReported
property.dc:description: Whether the ObservationCount includes all individuals detected during the sampling event (vs. only presence for example, or partial counts).

property.name: allSpeciesReported
property.dc:description: Whether the ObservationCount for a given taxon includes all individuals that have been detected within a higher taxonomic group, such as the class (eg, all Birds, all Fishes, or all Butterflies), as defined in the field ProtocolSpeciesTargeted, or as defined by the protocol. "No" should be used to indicate that the sampling event should not be used to infer negative observations (the absence of the species not reported within the scope of the protocol).

property.name: uTMZone
property.dc:description: The UTM zone of the location from which the organism was collected/observed.

property.name: uTMNorthing
property.dc:description: The UTM northing value of the location from which the organism was collected/observed.

property.name: uTMEasting
property.dc:description: The UTM easting value of the location from which the organism was collected/observed.

property.name: coordinatesUncertaintyInDecimalDegrees
property.dc:description: The upper limit of the distance (in decimal degrees) from the given latitude and longitude describing a circle within which the whole of the described locality must lie. Leave blank where the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates).

property.name: recordPermissions
property.dc:description: Permissions regarding the display and distribution of this record. Default value is 5 (public).

property.name: multiScientificName1
property.dc:description: Full scientific name of one of the possible taxa involved in this record, in cases where the record is one of several possible taxa. In cases of species grouping, the core taxonomic fields should only be provided if they apply to all possible taxa in the group. The various species that belong to this group should be listed for all records, even if some of them have not been actually detected in a specific record. Up to 6 member taxa can be recorded using the 6 MultiScientificName fields.
property.examples: Large Shorebirds could include birds from the genus Limosa sp., Numenius sp. and Tringa sp. The lowest common taxonomic unit in common is the family Scolopacidae.

property.name: multiScientificName2
property.dc:description: Full scientific name of one of the possible taxa involved in this record, in cases where the record is one of several possible taxa. In cases of species grouping, the core taxonomic fields should only be provided if they apply to all possible taxa in the group. The various species that belong to this group should be listed for all records, even if some of them have not been actually detected in a specific record. Up to 6 member taxa can be recorded using the 6 MultiScientificName fields.
property.examples: Large Shorebirds could include birds from the genus Limosa sp., Numenius sp. and Tringa sp. The lowest common taxonomic unit in common is the family Scolopacidae.

The various species that belong to this group should be listed for all records, even if some of them have not been actually detected in a specific record. Up to 6 member taxa can be recorded using the 6 MultiScientificName fields.
property.examples: Large Shorebirds could include birds from the genus Limosa sp., Numenius sp. and Tringa sp. The lowest common taxonomic unit in common is the family Scolopacidae.

property.name: multiScientificName6
property.dc:description: Full scientific name of one of the possible taxa involved in this record, in cases where the record is one of several possible taxa. In cases of species grouping, the core taxonomic fields should only be provided if they apply to all possible taxa in the group. The various species that belong to this group should be listed for all records, even if some of them have not been actually detected in a specific record. Up to 6 member taxa can be recorded using the 6 MultiScientificName fields.
property.examples: Large Shorebirds could include birds from the genus Limosa sp., Numenius sp. and Tringa sp. The lowest common taxonomic unit in common is the family Scolopacidae.

property.name: taxonomicAuthorityVersion
property.dc:description: Version number (including minor version or supplement number) of the taxonomic authority

property.name: taxonomicAuthorityYear
property.dc:description: Year of publication of the taxonomic authority, including minor version and supplement.

property.name: breedingBirdAtlasCode
property.dc:description: Breeding Bird Atlas evidence code, using North American Atlas Committee standards. See https://www.birdscanada.org/norac/

property.name: measurementType1
property.dc:description: The nature of OtherMeasurement1. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
property.examples: "tail length", "temperature", "trap line length", "survey area", "trap type", "isotopic signature".

property.name: measurementValue1
property.dc:description: Value of OtherMeasurementParameter1

property.name: measurementAccuracy1
property.dc:description: The description of the potential error associated with the OtherMeasurementValue1

property.name: measurementUnit1
property.dc:description: The units associated with the OtherMeasurementValue1. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

property.name: measurementDeterminedBy1
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the OtherMeasurement1.

property.name: measurementMethod1
property.dc:description: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the OtherMeasurement1

property.name: primaryMarkerType
property.dc:description: Type of primary marker (e.g. metal leg band)

property.name: primaryMarkerNumber
property.dc:description: Number of primary marker (e.g. band number)

property.name: auxiliaryMarkerType
property.dc:description: Other type of marker placed on the bird
property.examples: neck collar, web tag, wing tag

property.name: auxiliaryMarkerNumber
property.dc:description: Number of auxilliary marker (e.g. color band)

property.name: lastModifiedAction
property.dc:description: The last action that was taken on this record at DateLastModified.
property.examples: Possible values are UPDATE (existing record that was changed), INSERT (new record added) and DELETE (record removed, indicating that this record should be permanently excluded).

property.name: recordReviewStatus
property.dc:description: Current review status or decision regarding this individual record.
property.examples: no review needed, reviewed and accepted, not accepted, pending review
